attributes.comment:
The proposed increase in fees will cause a drastic impact economically for many who
wish to apply for visas from Mexico, Central and South America. Many are in search
for economic and educational opportunities, due to economic turmoil or minimal
educational opportunities in their homeland. I believe that immigrants who are
predominantly in a higher economic bracket constitute an extremely small percentage
of the applicants. The drastic increase would prove to be an obstacle for the less
fortunate who wish to provide a better life for their families. Many who belong to this
class do not all have the means to acquire the appropriate funds for the application
fees for their entire family yet an increase would make it that much more difficult.
Sacrifices are made to secure one family member's trip to the United States yet the
burden becomes more difficult when fees increase. This increase would also deter
legal entrance into the US. It would be economically feasible, though not legal, for
many to cross the border undetected than pay the higher fee and wait years for a visa.
This difference in increase represents the livelihood for a family who makes a fraction
of a minimum wage worker here in the US.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jeffrey Gallego
